intro: Ptisana werneri, commonly known as the Werneri's pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and nutrient-poor conditions. Ptisana werneri is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
